data.title: EMPLOYEES OF ADKOTURK MET AT THE PICNIC
data.text:
GIST 2023 game fair

GIST 2023 game fair ended with a victory for the Indomie Noodle brand this year. The Indomie booth overflowed with unforgettable moments and plenty of gifts for visitors. Indomie took its place at the GIST 2023 game fair, a meeting point for gamers, and organized a series of fun activities to provide an enjoyable experience for participants.

CS:GO Tournament:

The 5 vs. 5 CS:GO tournament held at the Indomie booth was met with great excitement. Participants in the tournament had the opportunity to win a big prize as the player who hit the most opponents. In addition, the other 9 participants won Indomie Boxes as consolation prizes.

Cosplay Beauty Contest:

Every day of the fair, the cosplay beauty contests held at the Indomie booth, with participants in colorful and creative costumes, received great interest from the audience. The winners were determined by the enthusiastic applause of the audience.

Instagram Selfie Campaign:

The gifts at the Indomie booth seemed never-ending. Visitors who shared the selfies they took at our booth on their Instagram accounts won 200.00 TL worth of Steam wallet code.

As the Indomie Family, we were delighted to meet and spend time with a young, energetic, and dynamic audience.

Special students both prepared and ate Indomie

With the joint project of Çerkezköy Special Education and Vocational Training Center and Çerkezköy-Lovers Association, we hosted 20 special students in our Indomie Instant Noodle factory.

The students who visited the first noodle factory in Türkiye were informed about the noodle production process, before preparing this food in the kitchen and enjoying its taste.

Çerkezköy Bakış - 20 special students studying at Çerkezköy Special Education and Vocational Training Center visited the Indomie Adkoturk factory as part of the "Social Life" course and the "We are Here to Overcome Obstacles" project with the contribution and support of the Çerkezköy-Lovers Association. Şafak Yendün, the marketing supervisor of the factory, informed the students about the noodle. After being informed, the students visited the factory and saw the production processes in place, and practiced in the practice kitchen.

GIFTS ARE PRESENTED

During the visit, where Mustafa Murat Sütçü, Director of the Çerkezköy Special Education and Vocational Training Center, and Murat Akay, Chairman of the Çerkezköy-Lovers Association, also attended, managers of the factory presented various gifts to the students. Students of Çerkezköy Special Education and Vocational Training Center also gave various gifts prepared at school to the managers of the factory. The managers of the factory stated that their company supported employing people suitable for the business environment.
